importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date marks the conclusion of Game 6 of the ALCS, setting the stage for Game 7, a pivotal moment in the postseason.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timing of the article's update reflects the live status of the game and the urgency of the postseason outcome.

keyTakeAways: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits his sixth home run of the postseason, extending Toronto's lead and forcing a Game 7.
The Seattle Mariners commit three errors, including two in the second inning, which directly lead to early runs and give Toronto a significant advantage.
The Blue Jays have not won a pennant since 1985, and this game marks their first appearance in a Game 7 since then.
Seattle's first Game 7 in franchise history underscores the significance of the matchup.
The winner of the ALCS faces the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, with Game 1 scheduled for Friday.
Mariners' pitcher Yesevage throws a season-high 31 splitters, records seven strikeouts, and effectively limits damage, showing growth and composure.
The game ends with a 6-2 score, and a wild pitch allows Guerrero to score, sealing the series at 4-2 in favor of Toronto.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits his sixth home run of the 2025 postseason, helping the Toronto Blue Jays defeat the Seattle Mariners 6-2 to force a decisive Game 7 in the American League Championship Series. The Mariners' season-high three errors—two in the second inning—proved costly, with fielding lapses by Julio Rodríguez and Eugenio Suárez allowing early runs. Toronto’s lead expanded to 5-0 after Guerrero’s solo shot in the fifth, and a wild pitch from Matt Brash in the seventh sealed the game. The Blue Jays, who have not won a pennant since 1985, are now set to face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series. Meanwhile, Mariners pitcher Trey Yesavage delivers a strong performance, throwing 31 splitters and limiting damage despite earlier struggles, highlighting a turning point in the series.
title: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits sixth homer of postseason as Blue Jays dominate Mariners to force ALCS Game 7
